ENTITY_DESC_CONSTRUCTION: Ad-hoc fortifications are being erected here.
ENTITY_DESC_LIGHT_INFANTRY: Lightly equipped and almost untrained, these men aren't the best for combat, but they're easy to pump out.
ENTITY_DESC_INFANTRY: The backbone of every army. Reliable, durable and most importantly, cheap.
ENTITY_DESC_ASSAULT_INFANTRY: Well trained, well equipped and ready for your command.
ENTITY_DESC_SNIPERS: Raised in the harsh taigas of Transkal, these men had to hunt to survive. Very good in rugged terrain.
ENTITY_DESC_HEAVY_SNIPER: These sniper wield anti-materiel rifles to combat the strongest of armor.
ENTITY_DESC_MARINES: Trained to attack and overrun beaches or rivers quickly. Capable of fighting on water as on land.
ENTITY_DESC_STORMTROOPERS: Well-trained veterans of the Akkadian War and well equipped with long-range weapons.
ENTITY_DESC_SPEC_OPS: These men are trained to infiltrate enemy lines and sabotage their infrastructure.
ENTITY_DESC_GUARDS: Having endured the most brutal training and education, they are ready to die for the nation.
ENTITY_DESC_PALADIN: The best of the best white guards become paladins, supersoldiers with terrific skill, courage and weaponry.
ENTITY_DESC_STRIKE_COMMANDO: Enemy Commandos and Trucks fear the property-capturing Strike Commando.
ENTITY_DESC_HEAVY_COMMANDO: Heavies like to engage tanks and capture properties.
ENTITY_DESC_SPIDER_TANK: The Spider Tank stuns its target to avoid counter attacks.
ENTITY_DESC_SUICIDE_BOMBER: These men literally throw lives away to thwart heavy tanks. Desperate, but efficient.
ENTITY_DESC_INFANTRY_TRUCK: Much faster than normal infantrymen, they are good if you want to occupy a lot of structures quickly.
ENTITY_DESC_SUPPLY_TRUCK: As if anyone had a doubt logistics win wars, this little fella is deceptively terrifying in the hands of a competent commander
ENTITY_DESC_ASEKARA_TANK: Standardized, easy to produce and easy to deploy, the Asekara Tank is the most cost-effective armored vehicle.
ENTITY_DESC_CRAB_TANK: The Crab cannot be stopped even by water. It can just as well fight in both environments.
ENTITY_DESC_COCKROACH: An annoying little bugger that can be mass-produced to piss off the enemy for good
ENTITY_DESC_BOLT_TANK: Extremely fast, fragile and ferocious against enemy infantry.
ENTITY_DESC_FLAK_TANK: Adapted to prevent enemy air supremacy, the Flak Tank shreds through aircraft.
ENTITY_DESC_TANK_HUNTER: Cleverly designed to destroy enemy tanks effectively, and be hard to destroy in return.
ENTITY_DESC_AMPAC: Incapable of making big tanks, Elam has considered to specialize them for action in rugged terrain.
ENTITY_DESC_AYIN: Forbidden technology; it shoots a neutron flux frontwards, irradiating scores of enemies. Its use will likely only be lawful for a decade or so.
ENTITY_DESC_GORLITZ_TANK: The Gorlitz Tank is powerful but plagued with inadequacies.
ENTITY_DESC_KOSCHEI: The pinnacle of Kargit engineering and Blitzkrieg doctrine, a wehrb's wet dream.
ENTITY_DESC_ENTWICKLUNG: Improving upon the Koschei's advantages and compensating its shortcomings; the ultimate main battle tank.
ENTITY_DESC_ENTWICKLUNG_MK2: Forbidden prototype. This tank deals massive damage but overheats easily.
ENTITY_DESC_IMPERTERRITUS: The Imperterritus is as terrifying to face as it is invulnerable to most weapons.
ENTITY_DESC_ROLAND: Combining Imperterritus's toughness and Koschei's speed to produce the ultimate battle tank.
ENTITY_DESC_BRIMSTONE_BATTERY: Cutting edge thermobaric artillery capable of unleashing literal fire and brimstone upon the enemy.
ENTITY_DESC_WARMACHINE: A marvel of engineering, can fully produce other units on the go.
ENTITY_DESC_HUNTER_SUPPORT: The true jack-of-all-trades. It can do about anything.
ENTITY_DESC_INTREPID: Capable of capturing buildings, like shipyards and oil rigs. Mmmmm, oil...
ENTITY_DESC_U_BOAT: Contrary to popular belief, it does NOT deal extra damage to big ships.
ENTITY_DESC_LEVIATHAN_BARGE: A barge designed with only one purpose in mind: To transport units.
ENTITY_DESC_CORVETTE_FIGHTER: Big guns, strong armor, but still reasonably affordable. Great for tormenting land units.
ENTITY_DESC_BATTLESHIP: Bigger guns, bigger armor, bigger hull, bigger range. Bigger everything. MORE DAKKA! BIGGER DAKKA!
ENTITY_DESC_SUPER_BATTLESHIP: Over 50.000 tons of steel for the ultimate dakka.
ENTITY_DESC_RAPTOR_FIGHTER: Fast and furious, specialized in hunting other enemy planes.
ENTITY_DESC_EAGLE_STRIKER: Made with the specific purpose of trolling land units.
ENTITY_DESC_CONDOR_BOMBER: For when you feel that the Eagle Striker doesn't carry enough dakka.
ENTITY_DESC_SOLOVEY_BOMBER: A heavy, sluggish bomber with massive payload. Devastating against infrastructure and fortifications.
ENTITY_DESC_ZEUS: Avant-garde technology, achieves much superior dogfighting and bombing results than any other plane.
ENTITY_DESC_STIHIE: Innovative plane design that maintains a very low radar signature while gunning down any enemy aircraft with advanced weaponry.
ENTITY_DESC_ALEPH: The supreme weapon; as destructive as it is terrifying. Will forever change the face of warfare.
ENTITY_DESC_STORK_TRANSPORT: Actually remarkable piece of engineering, capable of transporting some units via air.
ENTITY_DESC_TURRET: Capable of striking at land, sea and air units, the Turret is by far the most versatile fortification class.
ENTITY_DESC_BLOCKADE: Cheap and easy to erect static fortifications capable of delaying enemy advance for a short while.
ENTITY_DESC_MEME_BUREAUCRAT: This specimen of fucking idiot shithead subhuman animal bitch goes to work at 10:00AM, scratches his ass until 12:00AM then leaves at 14:00AM. He will send you on an endless chase for approvals, signatures and requests, all the while acting so superior. Wtf is wrong with you, you dumb bitch? Don't you realize you can easily be replaced by a monkey with a typewritter? I yearn for the day when you are replaced by robots, and if that day does not come then all of humanity must join together and genocide all bureaucrats.
